title: Keen 4 versions 1.3, 1.2, 1.1 and 1.0?
content:
Anyone has these? I know, there are links for downloading them in the official games thread, but these are just not working for me. Most links in dosclassics.com are broken right now. Did anybody download these before? Could give me them? They are shareware, so it shouldn't be illegal in any way.

I just like to collect old stuff. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] ------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Keen 4 versions 1.3, 1.2, 1.1 and 1.0?
content:
Perhaps I should get Apocalypse Gohan to email them to me, whereupon I'll add them to my list of stuff to add to dosclassics.

Way too many to for one sentence.

title: Re: Keen 4 versions 1.3, 1.2, 1.1 and 1.0?
content:
Keen 4 v1.0 can be downloaded from [url=http://www.classicdosgames.com/apogee.html]Classic DOS Games[/url]. It should also have the other versions, because it's one of the site goals to have every version available of the games that are on the site, but it hasn't.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Keen 4 versions 1.3, 1.2, 1.1 and 1.0?
content:

title: Re: dosclassicsdotcom patches!!
content: Don't use MegaUpload - the files will only go and disappear in a week or two. Get a [url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumother.showMessage?topicID=2474.topic]CKFS account[/url] instead.

title: Re: dosclassicsdotcom patches!!
content: I think someone should notify Xtraverse to update his official files thread (or have a mod update it if possible). It's quite outdated now.

title: Re: dosclassicsdotcom patches!!
content:
What we need is a patcher that autodetects version then patches it to what is needed, everything in one neat package![img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: dosclassicsdotcom patches!!
content: That shouldn't be too difficult, actually, although you'd probably want to write a custom patching solution. I might get round to that if I find a convenient Python module that does most of the work for me.

title: Re: dosclassicsdotcom patches!!
content:
Ask Monty then, he's always got something completely different.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]
